title: Understanding diverse ways of capital raising (Raman Bhalla)
text: By Raman Bhalla Aug 1, 2015 When it comes to capital raising, there is more than one way to do the same. The very first option begins with you. Being an entrepreneur, you can expect others to invest in you only if you yourself have the same confidence. There are many business owners that put almost their entire savings into small business in order to attract attention of investors and they succeed in the same because this shows how committed or serious they are about their project. But, what if you do not have adequate capital to invest? When such is the case, it is better not to launch unless and until you have something to offer. Below mentioned are some ways to raise capital:YourselfThere is no way you can escape this. Only in very rare chances a startup has happened without the founder spending any money. It necessarily need not be a huge amount. The total sum depends on the startup as well as other circumstances. Relatives and friendsEven though many business owners are reluctant to ask help of their relatives and friends, this is certainly one of the best options. Do not think that you will sound like you are pleading for capital. If you take everything in a professional way and treat your relatives or friends as your investors, everything will certainly go smoothly even if things do not work out. Financial institutions and lendersApplying for small business loans from conventional lenders can provide you with great interest rates and terms. The amount of funding you can secure from the lenders depends on your credit rating and the collateral you offer. For this you need to have well drafted business plan. This is an ideal means to get capital and you can make the most of your credit score at this time. Additionally, getting an approval for loan helps the investors to see that you are a genuine company. CrowdfundingIf due to some reason you are unable to secure small business loan myriad crowdfunding options are there for you. Perform a thorough research and rely on a reputable firm with great past record. Although this approach is less followed, it works well for many entrepreneurs. Make certain to carefully go through and understand the terms prior to closing the deal. Professional guidance of full time or part time CFO can be helpful in such a scenario. Investment firmsThis can be bit challenging to secure. While some firms have clear directions for pitching, others come to you by magic. Right marketing can really help in attracting investment companies. You might be what these companies are looking for, but if you lack exposure, you miss your opportunity. About the Author The author has been working as a professional part time CFO , Chief Financial Officer, for a long time and is well versed with the ways to raise capital. By sharing the same through his articles, he wants to help people to take right decisions when capital raising . Rating:
